titles.title: No Fame for Fraud Resolution
No Fame for Fraud Resolution

Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit a Member who is indicted for an offense involving financial or campaign finance fraud from receiving compensation for biographies, media appearances, or expressive or creative works, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

term.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

bill.summary:
No Fame for Fraud Resolution
This resolution prohibits a Member of the House of Representatives from receiving compensation for a biography, a media appearance, or other creative work if the Member is indicted for specified felony offenses (e.g., bribing public officials and defrauding the government) or offenses related to violations of campaign finance laws.
